relation: Some campuses have a cafeteria and some campuses do not, overall the food is really good.
There are no dorms at this school.
The courses do go by very fast, I've been through impacted programs before so I know what to expect. Be ready to complete more than 2 chapters every class meeting.

Stay on top of your studies because this school offers impacted courses, 1 month to complete each course you take. One week you have lectures and then you have an exam or quiz the next week. Keep your nose in the books. Also, make sure you have a lot of study time.

The teachers are extremely helpful when you have questions that need to be answered. When applying for this school, the academic advisors are thorough with each program you are interested in. And The class sizes are decent.
pageTitle: National University Reviews: Student Reviews and Ratings | Cappex

textAfterTable: Rebekah from El Cajon, CA 02/27/2012 Reviewer is A current student here. 2 out of 2 people found this review useful. 2 of 56 Categories Comments What to do for fun national university is located in san diego county. there is the zoo, museums, theaters and beaches all within an hours driving distance to the campus. Food and Dining i don't know what national university's amenities are in this regard. Dorm Life i live off campus and am not aware if national university offers a dorm. Academic Rigor i've found the classes to not be nearly as difficult as i had thought they would be. the amount of resources supplied online and through the textbooks are surprisingly comprehensive and informative, i haven't had any problem keeping up with the subjects. Tips for prospective students i found a great beginning to my education at national university with
